author: ppf.
content:
so once genesis happens, what exactly will happen?
- validators will start proposing and attesting for blocks
- given enough (>=2/3) of validators agree on the same blocks the first epoch that can be finalized is epoch 4
- deposits that happened after minGenesisTime-genesisDelay (non-genesis-deposits) will get voted for in 64epoch-ranges (so the next validators will get into queue after 32 epochs optimally)
is this correct? is there something else worth to be noted?

author: schone_wizard
content: i think the first epoch that can be finalized is epoch 1+2 which will happen during epoch 4

author: schone_wizard
content: and i thought genesis slot is considered finalized by mutual agreement per the spec, so not sure if that means maybe epoch 3 will be the one to finalize epoch 2

author: djrtwo
content:
I wrote this up for a testnet a while ago
https://notes.ethereum.org/@djrtwo/eth2-launch-metrics

It is possible to finalize epoch 1 and/or 2 during the epoch 3 to 4 transition
and yes, genesis is considered finalized as a base condition

author: djrtwo
content: at 256 epochs, the first "historical batch" gets written, but that's probably not something to publicly track too much
